detail_description: Located in Ragusa, Italy, Ristorante Locanda Don Serafino is a historic boutique hotel and restaurant that offers an exquisite dining experience. Chef Vincenzo Candiano skillfully utilizes locally sourced Sicilian ingredients to create tantalizing dishes. The three-course set lunch is highly recommended for its exceptional value, while the evening tasting menus are perfect for those seeking the full Candiano experience.
name: Ristorante Locanda Don Serafino
address: Via Avvocato Giovanni Ottaviano, 13, 97100 Ragusa RG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in a quiet side street of the charming town of Cefalu, Il Carretto is a delightful trattoria that embodies the essence of authentic Sicilian dining. With its warm mustard walls and traditional mahogany furnishings, this eatery exudes a cozy atmosphere where laughter and lively conversations fill the air beneath stunning vaulted brick ceilings. The menu is refreshingly dynamic, featuring beloved Sicilian classics at reasonable prices.
name: Ristorante Il carretto
address: Via Mandralisca, 66, 90015 Cefalù PA, Italy

detail_description: Ristorante la Madia is a renowned two Michelin-starred restaurant located in the unassuming town of Licata, Sicily. Chef Pino Cuttaia's culinary expertise shines through his creations, which skillfully blend Sicilian tradition with innovation. The menu features dishes that pay homage to the island's peasant heritage while incorporating locally sourced ingredients. Guests can choose from three tasting menus or opt for the a la carte selection.
name: Ristorante la Madia
address: Corso Filippo Re Capriata, 22, 92027 Licata AG, Italy

excerpt: Art exibits & tasting menus with modern takes on classic Sicilian recipes in a cozy, stylish space.
detail_description: Gagini is a stylish restaurant located in the former studio of 16th-century sculptor Antonello Gagini in Palermo. The space offers a cozy and dramatic setting with ancient stone walls, ceramic Teste di Moro, and wrought iron candlesticks. The tasting menu features modern interpretations of classic Sicilian recipes by chef Mauricio Zillo, drawing on his Italian-Brazilian background.
name: Ristorante Gagini
address: Via dei Cassari, 35, 90133 Palermo PA, Italy

excerpt: Raw seafood, plus regional meat & pasta dishes, at terrace tables with views of Taormina's duomo.
detail_description: Ristorante al Duomo Taormina is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Taormina, Sicily. It is beloved by both locals and visitors for its delectable regional cuisine and stunning views. The restaurant offers a mix of seafood, meat, and pasta dishes with a touch of fine dining elegance. With balcony seating overlooking the town square, guests can enjoy the picturesque sights of the baroque-style fountain and the impressive Taormina Cathedral while savoring their meals.
name: Ristorante al Duomo Taormina
address: Vico degli Ebrei, 11, 98039 Taormina ME, Italy

excerpt: Stylishly plated contemporary Italian dishes in a sleek, modern space overlooking ancient temples.
detail_description: Il Re di Girgenti is a stylish restaurant offering contemporary Italian cuisine in a modern setting with views of ancient temples. The city of Agrigento, formerly known as Akragas and Agrigentum, was once a prosperous center of Greek civilization in Sicily, boasting magnificent temples and a rich history. Despite its proximity to ancient landmarks, the restaurant's trendy ambiance appeals to young locals with its hip decor and country-chic atmosphere.
name: Il Re di Girgenti
address: Via Panoramica Valle dei Templi, 51, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Ristorante Don Camillo in Ortigia, Siracusa is a renowned family-run restaurant that captures the essence of contemporary Sicilian cuisine. Established in 1985, this elegant establishment exudes timeless charm with its 15th-century tufa walls, antique furnishings, and a captivating wrought-iron chandelier. The ambiance is further enhanced by the presence of stacked wine bottles and vintage sketches adorning the delicately arched rooms.
name: Ristorante Don Camillo - Ortigia - Siracusa
address: Via della Maestranza, 96, 96100 Siracusa SR, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque setting of Grand Hotel Timeo, Otto Geleng Restaurant offers a dining experience that captures the essence of Sicily. The terrace, adorned with bougainvillea and illuminated by oil lamps, sets the stage for a memorable meal. The menu celebrates Sicilian produce with options ranging from locally caught fish to flavorful vegetarian dishes.
name: Otto Geleng Restaurant
address: Via Teatro Greco, 59, 98039 Taormina ME, Italy

excerpt: Relaxed property offering breakfast, a restaurant & a bar, plus a spa, an outdoor pool & sea views.
detail_description: Hotel Signum is a luxurious property located in Malfa, on the island of Salina. Surrounded by lush vegetation and overlooking the crystal-clear blue sea, this hotel offers a serene and relaxed atmosphere for travelers. The elegant simplicity of the materials used in its construction, such as stone, lime walls, and porcelain, adds to its charm. Guests can enjoy breathtaking sunsets from the splendid terrace that overlooks Stromboli and Panarea.
name: Hotel Signum
address: V. Pastificio, 98050 Malfa ME, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant streets of Catania, Orazio Cordai is a hidden gem that embodies the city's rich street food culture. While Catania may not boast the polished charm of Palermo or Syracuse, it offers an authentic culinary experience that shouldn't be missed. This unassuming eatery might lack extravagant decor, but its legendary crispelle pastries are a must-try for any food lover.
name: Ristorante Orazio Cordai freat & food
address: Viale Libertà, 13, 95024 Acireale CT, Italy

detail_description: Frumento Pizzeria Acireale is a renowned pizzeria located near the fish market in Acireale, close to the historic center and just a short walk from Raciti Palace. It has received several accolades, including being named the best pizzeria in Sicily in 2019. The pizzeria offers a variety of delicious pizzas and a selection of different doughs to choose from. Visitors can expect an excellent dining experience with high-quality ingredients and exceptional service.
name: Frumento Pizzeria Acireale
address: Piazza Giuseppe Mazzini, 95024 Acireale CT, Italy

excerpt: Lively canal-side terrace for Sicilian pasta & seafood, with views of the sunset over salt flats.
detail_description: Mamma Caura is a unique dining spot located in the Trapani province of Marsala city, within the SEI - Saline Ettore and Infersa. The restaurant is housed in a renovated shack inside the Saltpans of Marsala and offers a multi-level experience.
name: Mamma Caura
address: senza numero civico, Contrada Ettore Infersa, 91025 Marsala TP, Italy

detail_description: Caffè Sicilia, a renowned establishment in Noto, is a must-visit for those craving authentic Sicilian pastries. Featured on Netflix's Chef's Table Pastry Season, this classic café on Corso Vittorio Emanuele offers an ideal setting to savor traditional treats like cannoli and cassata. With a history dating back to 1892, it stands as a symbol of Sicilian pastry-making excellence under the guidance of Master Confectioner Corrado Assenza.
name: Caffè Sicilia
address: Corso Vittorio Emanuele, 125, 96017 Noto SR, Italy

excerpt: Intimate locale offering sweet treats, pastries & savory snacks, plus terrace dining.
detail_description: Pasticceria Savia is a historic patisserie that has been serving delectable sweet treats, pastries, and savory snacks since 1897. Located on the lively Via Etnea street, it offers an intimate dining experience with terrace seating. The highlight of their menu is the colossal arancini - deep-fried rice fritters filled with tender ragu, cheese, or butter.
name: Pasticceria Savia
address: Via Etnea, 300/302/304, 95131 Catania CT, Italy

detail_description: Gran Cafè Solaire is a charming spot just a short walk from the sea in Acitrezza, offering an intense and pure pistachio granita that stands out. The place has affordable prices and a diverse menu with delicious arancini. While the service could be improved, they offer unique granita flavors like fig, cantaloupe, pomegranate, and blood orange.
name: Gran Cafè Solaire
address: Via Provinciale, 81, 95021 Aci Castello CT, Italy

detail_description: Alla Kasbah is a renowned restaurant in Mazara del Vallo, Sicily, known for serving the famous Caponata dish and the Gambero Rosso of Mazara - red prawns. The restaurant offers a mix of North African cuisine and local specialties, creating a unique dining experience. Visitors praise the fresh ingredients used in their dishes and recommend trying the fish couscous and Busiata con Gamberi.
name: Alla Kasbah
address: Via Itria, 10, 91026 Mazara del Vallo TP, Italy

excerpt: Sicilian seafood pasta & meats in a rustic trattoria with tables in a narrow alley.
detail_description: Nestled in a charming alleyway just behind the stunning Norman Cathedral, Ristorante La Galleria is a delightful find for anyone exploring the historic streets of Palermo. This rustic trattoria offers an authentic taste of Sicilian cuisine, featuring delectable seafood pasta and hearty meat dishes that are sure to satisfy any palate.
name: La Galleria
address: Salita Ramirez, 2, 90134 Palermo PA, Italy

excerpt: Neighborhood joint whipping up large homemade sandwiches made with locally sourced ingredients.
detail_description: Caseificio Borderi is a charming family-owned shop nestled in the Ortigia Market, known for its delectable homemade sandwiches and artisanal Sicilian products. The owner, Andrea Borderi, also known as the Panini Maestro, crafts enormous made-to-order sandwiches filled with an array of Sicilian cheeses, charcuterie, olives, tomatoes, and more. The shop's long line is entertained with samples as they eagerly await their turn to witness Mr.
name: Caseificio Borderi
address: Via Emmanuele de Benedictis, 6, 96100 Siracusa SR, Italy

detail_description: TINCHITE Taverna & Putia is a popular restaurant located on a charming pedestrian lane in historic Cefalu. Known for its consistently delicious food, the casual eatery often has a queue, so it's advisable to book a table or arrive early.
name: TINCHITE' Taverna & Putia
address: Via XXV Novembre, 37, 90015 Cefalù PA, Italy

excerpt: Fish dishes & pasta, plus an extensive wine list, in a stone-lined space or at courtyard tables.
detail_description: Osteria dei Vespri is a charming restaurant located in the historic center of Palermo, owned by brothers Andrea and Alberto Rizzo. The intimate stone-lined space offers a menu featuring traditional Sicilian dishes with a modern twist, often incorporating specialties from around the world. The seasonal offerings highlight seafood specialties such as red tuna with Nebrodi almond crust, mustard, yogurt, shallots, and wild chicory.
name: Osteria dei Vespri
address: Piazza Croce dei Vespri, 6, 90133 Palermo PA, Italy

detail_description: "A Cucchiara" is a charming restaurant located near Piazza del Duomo in the heart of Messina. The cozy atmosphere and open kitchen provide a unique dining experience, with owner Peppe Giamboi personally engaging guests with his culinary storytelling. The menu features ever-changing dishes, highlighting excellent vegetable-based creations and delightful local cod preparations. Guests can savor dishes like stocco in ghiotto or cod in orange-lemon sauce with fried leeks.
name: 'A Cucchiara
address: Strada S. Giacomo, 19, 98122 Messina ME, Italy

name: Gelateria Le Cuspidi
address: Via dei Giardini, 4, 92100 San Leone AG, Italy

detail_description: Lounge Beach Scala dei Turchi is a beach club and restaurant located at the base of the stunning natural attraction known as the Turkish Stairs (Scala dei Turchi) near Agrigento. Visitors can reserve a comfortable spot on their deck just steps away from the water, offering a perfect setting for soaking up the sun. While there may not be public transportation to Scala dei Turchi, during peak season, there is a shuttle service available.
name: Lounge Beach Scala dei Turchi
address: SP68, 92010 Realmonte AG, Italy

excerpt: Established outfit offering cannoli, cassata & other classic confectionery, plus savory options.
detail_description: Pasticceria Artale is a renowned establishment in Syracuse, offering a wide selection of classic Sicilian confectionery such as cannoli and cassata. Additionally, they serve savory options for lunch and dinner. For a delightful start to your day, Voglia Matta is recommended for its tantalizing array of Sicilian sweets and exceptional granita.
name: Pasticceria Artale
address: Via Saverio Landolina, 32, 96100 Siracusa SR, Italy

excerpt: Tasting menus of refined regional meat & seafood paired with Sicilian wines in an elegant setting.
detail_description: Ristorante Duomo is a renowned dining establishment in Ragusa, Italy, offering refined regional meat and seafood dishes paired with Sicilian wines. The restaurant is owned by Ciccio Sultano, considered one of Sicily's greatest chefs. Guests can indulge in tasting menus featuring fabulous local ingredients during lunch or dinner. Additionally, the chef's latest venture, Banchi, serves as a bakery, deli, and cafe providing exceptional breakfast options and relaxed lunches.
name: Duomo Ristorante
address: Ibla, Via Capitano Bocchieri, 31, 97100 Ragusa RG, Italy

detail_description: Arte e Tradizione is a pizzeria popular with Palermo locals and recommended by local residents. The pizzas are simple but delicious, with a wide selection of pies to choose from. The atmosphere is friendly and unpretentious, making it a great place to visit for a casual evening out.
name: Arte e Tradizione
address: Via Santa Teresa, 2, 90133 Palermo PA, Italy

excerpt: Artfully presented Sicilian pasta, fish & seafood dishes in a bright space within the fish market.
detail_description: Osteria Antica Marina is a Sicilian restaurant located in La Pescheria, Catania's largest fish market. The restaurant offers artfully presented pasta, fish, and seafood dishes in a bright space within the market. It is described as more upscale than other nearby restaurants and is recommended by locals as the perfect match to the market. The menu highlights the city's best seafood, with options for prix-fixe or a la carte dining.
name: Osteria Antica Marina
address: Zona Pescheria, Via Pardo, 29, 95121 Catania CT, Italy

excerpt: Seafood pasta, grilled meats & a daily fish special, served at al fresco tables in a cozy courtyard.
detail_description: Osteria Rosso Divino is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Taormina, Sicily. Established since 1869, it holds a historical significance and offers a cozy courtyard dining experience. The restaurant is known for its seafood pasta, grilled meats, and daily fish specials. Managed by Sicilian sisters and their friends, the place exudes warmth and hospitality. The open kitchen with blue and white tiles adds to the inviting ambiance.
name: Osteria Rosso Divino
address: Via De Spuches, 8, 98039 Taormina ME, Italy

detail_description: Principe Cerami is a renowned restaurant located in the San Domenico Palace Hotel in Taormina. The restaurant, overseen by chef Massimo Mantarro, offers an intimate and romantic dining experience with stunning views of the bay. Known for its haute cuisine with Sicilian influences, Principe Cerami presents dishes like homemade ravioli with saffron and Mediterranean red mullet stuffed with vegetable caponata.
name: Principe Cerami
address: Piazza S. Domenico de Guzman, 5, 98039 Taormina ME, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in a charming alley behind the Duomo, Kisté is the more casual counterpart to La Capinera, both overseen by chef Pietro D'Agostino. Housed in a 15th-century building adorned with white arches and terracotta floors, this eatery offers an inviting outdoor terrace for enjoying delightful aperitivos. The menu features "easy gourmet" dishes that are simpler yet still reflect the chef's culinary expertise.
name: Kisté - easy gourmet
address: Via S. Maria de Greci, 2, 98039 Taormina ME, Italy

excerpt: Intimate, elegant restaurant serving upscale, carefully sourced dishes & wines, plus a tasting menu.
detail_description: "I Banchi" is an intimate and elegant restaurant located in the monumental spaces of the eighteenth-century Palazzo Di Quattro. It was created by Ciccio Sultano as a contemporary reinterpretation of a traditional trattoria, offering carefully sourced dishes and wines with an informal and convivial atmosphere. The restaurant's kitchen, led by Marco Corallo, focuses on crafting simple cuisine using high-quality raw ingredients. One of the standout dishes is the Free-range Chicken.
name: I Banchi
address: Via Orfanotrofio, 39, 97100 Ragusa RG, Italy

excerpt: Tasting menus of Sicilian dishes with a twist, plus wine pairing, in a stylish, understated space.
detail_description: Ristorante Crocifisso, located in the charming Baroque town of Noto, is a stylish and understated space offering tasting menus of Sicilian dishes with a twist, paired with a selection of organic and biodynamic wines. The restaurant is known for its creative fusion of Sicilian traditions with continental flair by chef Marco Baglieri, who spent part of his childhood in Germany. Despite being situated in the upper town, it is considered one of Noto's best restaurants.
name: Ristorante Crocifisso
address: Via Principe Umberto, 46/48, 96017 Noto SR, Italy

detail_description: This restaurant is rustic, historic and eclectic, with great vegetarian food. It's run by a couple of old Sicilians and it's highly recommended.
name: Trattoria La Foglia
address: Via Capodieci, 29, 96100 Siracusa SR, Italy

detail_description: Bye Bye Blues is a renowned Michelin-starred restaurant located near Mondello beach in Palermo. Founded by Patrizia Di Benedetto and Antonio Barraco, the restaurant has gained acclaim for its Sicilian cuisine since its establishment in 1991. Chef Benedetto uses local ingredients to create innovative dishes such as paccheri with cod sauce, roasted peppers, black sesame, and toasted almonds. The extensive wine list showcases selections from Sicily, Italy, and other iconic wine regions worldwide.
name: Bye Bye Blues
address: Via del Garofalo, 23, 90100 Palermo PA, Italy

detail_description: Km.0 is a charming restaurant run by the young brothers Marco and Fabio Cannizzaro, who have transformed their grandfather's metalworking shop into a cozy 25-seat dining spot. The menu showcases traditional Sicilian cuisine using locally sourced ingredients, with a focus on Etna's produce and native Sicilian wines. The restaurant has been recognized by the Michelin Guide for its exceptional wine selection, earning it the prestigious grape cluster symbol.
name: Km.0
address: Via Antonino Longo, 26, 95125 Catania CT, Italy

detail_description: Forno Biancuccia, run by Valeria Messina in Catania, Sicily, is a charming bakery dedicated to preserving Sicilian bread-making traditions and heirloom wheat varieties. Valeria uses 100% wholemeal flour and sourdough starter to create crusty sourdough loaves, focaccia, buttery biscotti, and traditional pizza marinara. The bakery's name comes from the biancuccia variety of wheat that they use.
name: Forno Biancuccia
address: Via Mario Sangiorgi, 12, 95129 Catania CT, Italy

detail_description: Bottega Tivitti is a beachside restaurant with a pleasant atmosphere and attentive service. While the portions are small, the staff is polite and friendly. The cuisine may not be exceptional, but it is still recommended. Despite being located by the sea, this restaurant offers fresh and delicious dishes served promptly by knowledgeable and friendly staff. Although it may not be cheap by local standards, Bottega Tivitti stands out for its quality food and service in contrast to typical overpriced seaside locations.
name: Bottega Tivitti
address: Lungomare Giuseppe Giardina, 7, 90015 Cefalù PA, Italy

excerpt: Relaxed restaurant with a patio specializing in pizza, plus seafood, pasta & shared plates.
detail_description: Grani da Re - Pizzeria & Ristorante is a laid-back dining spot featuring a charming patio, specializing in delectable pizza, seafood, pasta, and shared plates. Located near the tourist harbor of Castellammare del Golfo, it prides itself on using locally sourced artisanal and sustainable ingredients for its dishes. The menu offers various types of naturally leavened dough that undergo a 48-hour maturation process for exceptional digestibility.
name: Grani da Re - Pizzeria & Ristorante 🌾👑🍕
address: Via Giacomo Medici, 30, 91014 Castellammare del Golfo TP, Italy

excerpt: Elegant dining room & terrace with refined modern Sicilian dishes, tasting menus & a long wine list.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Taormina's city center, Vineria Modì offers an elegant dining experience with a refined modern Sicilian menu and an extensive wine list. Originally a charming wine bar, it has evolved into a sophisticated restaurant known for its diverse and delectable menu catering to various dietary preferences. The restaurant boasts an impressive collection of over 1,000 distinct labels. Guests can enjoy tasting menus or opt for à la carte options.
name: Vineria Modì
address: Via Calapitrulli, 13, 98039 Taormina ME, Italy

detail_description: La Tonda Fritta is a popular snack shop near Porta Trapani in Sicily, known for its wide variety of arancini, or fried rice balls. With over 35 flavors including swordfish, smoked salmon, and curry fillings, as well as vegetarian and vegan options, it offers something for everyone. The shop allows customers to watch the cook prepare the arancini while they wait.
name: La Tonda Fritta
address: Via Vittorio Emanuele, 100, 91016 Erice TP, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sicily, Al Fogher is a charming restaurant housed in a restored old railway tollgate. Chef Angelo Treno's culinary philosophy seamlessly blends contemporary gastronomic creativity with traditional Sicilian cuisine, offering patrons an authentic and unforgettable dining experience. The menu features innovative dishes such as truffle-topped pastas and caviar-infused creations that showcase the region's finest ingredients.
name: Al Fogher
address: Viale Conte Ruggero (exSS 117 bis) - Contrada Bellia incrocio SS 288 per, 94015 Aidone EN, Italy

detail_description: In Cucina Dai Pennisi is a unique dining spot located in Linguaglossa, known for its combination of a butcher shop and a restaurant. The establishment has been serving high-quality locally produced meats since 1960 and recently expanded to include a 30-seat restaurant space at the back of the butcher shop. Guests can choose from an array of meats displayed in the front cases, including dry-aged beef, house-made sausages, poultry, and more.
name: In Cucina Dai Pennisi
address: Via Umberto I, 11, 95015 Linguaglossa CT, Italy

detail_description: Ristorante Canni & Pisci is a delightful gem that beautifully showcases the culinary traditions of Catania, both from land and sea. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between casual charm and refined elegance, making it an inviting spot for diners. Here, you can indulge in a diverse array of appetizers that range from raw to cooked dishes, hot to cold selections. The menu features local favorites like fish Norma and expertly grilled catches of the day prepared with classic techniques.
name: Ristorante Canni & Pisci
address: Via Museo Biscari, 8, 95131 Catania CT, Italy

detail_description: VITIS is a dynamic winemaking reality located in one of Sicily's most distinctive areas, the Etna region. The vineyards benefit from the volcanic soil, mineral-rich terrain, mountain cold, and Sicilian sun. The Vigneri, local winegrowers with a long tradition, cultivate the historic vines naturally and sustainably. The winery is associated with renowned enologist Salvo Foti who revived this ancient consortium.
name: VITIS VINERIA
address: Via Fcesco Fisauli, 7, 95036 Randazzo CT, Italy

detail_description: Caffè dell'Arte is a charming café located in Modica, offering a delightful array of Sicilian pastries and sweets. Established in 1967, this cozy spot is known for its freshly made breakfast treats, including ricotta-filled brioche and coffee granita. The aroma of delicious brioches fills the air as they come straight out of the oven. Visitors can also indulge in local specialties such as cannoli and Modican chocolate.
name: Caffè dell'Arte
address: Via Sacro Cuore, 64a, 97015 Modica RG, Italy

detail_description: The bakery Panificio Giummarra is a local favourite for locals and tourists alike. They offer delicious hand-made biscuits and breads which are of excellent quality. The bakery is brightly coloured and has a rustic feel, making it an ideal place to have breakfast or relax after a busy day.
name: Panificio Giummarra
address: Via Traspontino, 23, 97100 Ragusa RG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in a charming old district of Catania, A Putia Do Calabrisi stands as a testament to the city's rich culinary heritage. This casual eatery has been a cherished favorite among locals for decades, maintaining its authentic vibe and traditional dishes without succumbing to modern trends. The experience here is unique; diners are seated by friendly staff who guide you to your spot, creating an inviting atmosphere filled with the lively chatter of Sicilian patrons.
name: A Putia Do Calabrisi
address: Via della Concordia, 185, 95121 Catania CT, Italy

excerpt: Local seafood dishes in a rustic, wood-beamed eatery with ocean views from a large covered terrace.
detail_description: Ristorante da Filippino a Lipari is a charming, rustic eatery with a large covered terrace offering stunning ocean views. The restaurant is renowned for its delectable seafood dishes and has been a favorite among locals and tourists for years. The menu features an array of fresh catches, including sea urchin, swordfish, squid, and tuna.
name: Ristorante da Filippino a Lipari
address: Piazza Giuseppe Mazzini, 98055 Lipari ME, Italy

detail_description: Located in the historical center of Palermo, MEC Restaurant is a unique dining spot housed in a sixteenth-century building. The restaurant doubles as a museum dedicated to Steve Jobs and his innovations, featuring an elegant and pop architecture. The cuisine by Carmelo Trentacosti reflects the context with its emphasis on technique, color, and carefully selected raw materials.
name: MEC Restaurant
address: Via Vittorio Emanuele, 452, 90134 Palermo PA, Italy

excerpt: Convivial restaurant with an open kitchen & sidewalk tables for grilled fish & raw seafood dishes.
detail_description: If you're looking for a relaxing Mediterranean restaurant in the heart of town, Quello che c'è c'è is definitely worth checking out. The open kitchen and sidewalk tables make it easy to enjoy fresh fish and seafood dishes, while the highchairs are available and the bar serves up quality drinks. The only downside is that it can get pretty crowded, so be sure to plan your visit ahead.
name: Quello Che C’è C’è... Ristorantemediterraneo sull’isola dal 2004
address: Via Giuseppe Garibaldi, 38, 91023 Favignana TP, Italy
